============================================================================
CSL_armGicCommonIntrHandler

Description
This function is used to check if MMU is enabled.

Arguments
None

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Example 

     CSL_armGicCommonIntrHandler(); // Enable the L1D cache

static uint32_t CSL_armGicGetGicIdForIrqInputLine ( uint32_t  irqInputLine)
inlinestatic

============================================================================
CSL_armGicGetGicIdForIrqInputLine

Description
This API returns the ARM GIC ID for a given IRQ Input line.

Arguments 

      IRQ Input Line

Return Value
Corresponding GIC Id

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Example 

    uint32_t   gicId;
    uint32_t   irqInputLine = (uint32_t) 44U;
    gicId      = CSL_armGicGetGicIdForIrqInputLine (irqInputLine);
static CSL_ArmGicIntrSupport_t CSL_armGicIsIntrSupported ( const CSL_ArmGicDistIntrf *  gicInst,
uint32_t  intrNum 
)
inlinestatic

This API checks if the interrupt is supported. GIC doesn't need to implement the interrupts in continous range. So each interrupt should be checked if it is supported. It also checks if the interrupt is permanently enabled.

============================================================================
CSL_armGicInit

Description
This function is used to initialize MMU registers.

Arguments
None

Return Value
None

Pre Condition
None

Post Condition
None

Example 

     CSL_armGicInit();
   If the processor implements the Security Extensions, Secure software
   determines which interrupts are visible to Non-secure software.
   So in such systems secure init must happen before NS configurations.
Parameters
intrNum- Interrupt number
Returns
intrSupport_t - return if the interrupt is supported
